intro: Asyneuma otites, commonly known as the yellow false dandelion, is a herbaceous plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its yellow flowers bloom in clusters, and the plant is often found in open fields and along roadsides. Asyneuma otites is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
